Title: Kitchen table day

Description:
Thank you for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page. 

My name is Jo and I love to dance, especially in the kitchen to 80s tracks! Throughout the last few months, I have been running fun dance-fitness classes virtually on Zoom and Facebook which has brought a lot of joy to many people including myself. 

So I would love you to join me for a 6-hour dance extravaganza on Saturday 14th November from 1-7pm in support of the wonderful Nottingham-based charity Pasic who provide the families of children and young people with cancer in the East Midlands with emotional, practical, and social support. The money raised from the danceathon will go towards Christmas treats and gifts for the children being treated on children's cancer wards in the East Midlands as well as offering much needed support to parents during such a difficult time which has been heightened due to the pandemic. Pasic would also usually host their ball at this time of year which raises a lot of money for the charity so I'm hoping to offset that, even if just a little with the money raised.

As well as plenty of themed Kitchen Dancing from ABBA Mania to 80s Pop through to Disco and Musicals, we're delighted to welcome guest dance instructors offering a variety of dance genres including: -

- FitSteps and seated SOSA with Catherine Chivers from Manor Arts - https://catherinechivers.wixsite.com/manor-arts
- Teenyboppers with Steph Metson Scott
- Belly Dancing with Hannah Enderby (Keep Fit and Carry On!)
- Fitness Fun with comedienne Jemma 'Flashdancer' Bennett (Stand Up from the Shed)
- Power ballad weight workout with Louise Strain from Be Motivated Coaching - https://bemotivatedcoaching.com/ 
- Latino beats, Family Boogie, 80s & 90s & a Vogue dance workshop with Jo '80s child' Porter PLUS loads more


Full schedule is below and join in at any time. The event Zoom link will automatically be sent to you by e-mail if you donate via this page or alternatively register your interest at https://www.trybooking.co.uk/VIM.  The event is open to a maximum of 500 participants over the duration of 6 hours so please join is as early as you can to guarantee your place. As this is a live, virtual event, we can't guarantee there won't be any technical or wi-fi issues but fingers crossed!

On a personal note, I would like to dedicate this event to the memory of a very special girl, my cousin Rose Whittle, a bright shining star who loved to dance, sing and entertain with her jokes. Rose was diagnosed with Neuroblastoma in 2011, at just 7 years old, and her positivity and light shone throughout her gruelling course of treatment at QMC in Nottingham which she battled through courageously for over 2 years. We devastatingly lost Rose in 2013 but her memory lives on in all of us who loved her so dearly which brings us hope and inspiration everyday.

Title: Maria's page

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

The Made With Love ‚ù§Ô∏è Chicken Soup Run began at the beginning of Lockdown 2020 delivering delicious homemade chicken soup to a few elderly neighbours. 

Two weeks later we were delivering ‚ÄúGoody Bags‚Äù with home made Chicken Soup, a savoury dish, cake, fresh fruit salad and a challah bread to 20  alone, elderly, unwell, and isolating recipients in Essex. 

And‚Ä¶.. it didn‚Äôt take long for the word to spread and we were up to 80. 

After lockdown finished, Loughton Synagogue and our Rabbi Yanky encouraged us to use their premises to continue. We have their full support, Rabbi Levi and Leah even make our delicious kneidlach. 

We now deliver 150 ‚ÄúGoody Bags‚Äù all over Essex and it grows each week, all prepared and cooked at Loughton synagogue by our amazing volunteers every Thursday even with children helping with some of packing, and then packed on a Friday before being delivered by our wonderful volunteer drivers, from Loughton, Chigwell and Wanstead and Woodford Shuls. 

Our delicious cakes are made by Sandra Waldman in Chigwell shul and sponsored by their members!! 

In Lockdown we delivered 20 very full ‚ÄúGoody Bags‚Äù each week to the Essex Ambulance Service so they good have some nutritious food while waiting for hours outside the hospitals 

Our recipients depend on our nutritious bags each week and it is a lifeline to them. Our drivers chat to them on the doorstep and help out when necessary. 

What started as an idea throughout Covid has made such a difference, it is now an institution in the area! 

All our amazing volunteers are putting on their trainers to walk 10k on the 24th October to raise 10k enabling us to continue this incredible initiative! 

80 year olds to 5 year olds are walking! 

PLEASE HELP US KEEP ‚ÄúTHE MADE WITH LOVE CHICKEN SOUP RUN‚Äù - RUNNING!! 

It‚Äôs vital - We can‚Äôt stop this working!
Title: THE MADE WITH LOVE  CHICKEN SOUP RUN page

Description:
Love never fails. 
Coronavirus impacts all of us. But love unites us all. 

As this virus spreads across the world, love rises up in response. 

Youve already shown incredible kindness to your neighbours. 
Now is the time to reach out to your neighbours both near and far. 

Your love protects. From storms, from drought, and now from coronavirus. 
Your love protects our global neighbours battling the spread of this illness. 
Your love protects. With soap, clean water and medical supplies. 

By supporting us this Christian Aid Week you can reach out and protect more of your neighbours today. 

For over 70 years, we've been standing with the poorest of our neighbours, with people of all faiths and none, to stand up for dignity, equality and justice. Let's stand together with our neighbours near and far.

Description:
What is the Waterloo Foodbank?

The Waterloo Foodbank exists to provide 3 days of nutritionally balanced emergency food to local people in crisis.

They work with frontline care professionals to identify those in need. 

All food given out is donated by the public

ABOUT THE FOODBANK

They exist to ensure that no one in Waterloo goes hungry.

For people on low incomes, a sudden crisis ‚Äì redundancy, benefit delay, illness or even an unexpected bill ‚Äì can mean going hungry. Every day parents skip meals to feed their children and people are forced to choose between paying the rent or eating.

Since their launch at the end of 2011 they‚Äôve given away over 90 tonnes of food to over 11,000 people in need, including over 4,000 local children.

They are part of The Trussell Trust‚Äôs UK-wide foodbank network, and together they provide food to thousands of people nationwide every year. The Foodbank is hosted at Oasis Playspace, Chapter 1 and St George the Martyr on behalf of South Bank Churches.

Help us to support the fantastic work of the Waterloo Foodbank!
Title: Oasis Waterloo FoodBank - Soup-A-Stars

Description:
We are a local, growing driving school, and we're hosting a Mock Test Day. This is where full licence holders can visit us, and one of our friendly instructors will take the full licence holder out for a 30 minute mock driving test, assess their driving, and provide feedback and results at the end. 

We're really interested to see how many full licence holders still have the skills to pass their driving test - whether they've been driving for 1 year, or 15 years. 

We'd love for this to be a fun, informal event, where people can put their driving skills to the test, whilst raising money for such a deserving, hard working, local charity. 

We hope to see you there!

Description:
No matter how much you do, physical activity is good for your body and mind. Being active is one of the five ways to well being and adults should aim to be active every day.

To motivate our team to keep moving and raise much needed funds for Southport Soup Kitchen, we have signed up to a workplace step challenge. Pledging to each take 300,000 steps throughout the month of March. That is MILLIONS of steps together.

The "Soupie" haven't been able to accept donations of food for many months due to the ongoing Coronavirus pandemic. This has made their efforts to support local people and their families even more difficult. Monetary donations are now absolutely vital in order to provide vouchers for those in need to buy food and essentials from local supermarkets.

We sincerely appreciate all donations that will help Southport Soup Kitchen continue to provide warm food, a place to rest and good company for the disadvantaged of Southport.

A daily brisk walk can boost your energy, lift your mood and make everyday activities easier. Walking is simple, free and one of the easiest ways to get more active and become healthier. 

More information on the health benefits of walking can be found by following the link below. It also has resources for walks with wheelchairs and walks with buggys as well as guides to exercising indoors for those who aren't able to get out and about.


Walking for health - NHS (www.nhs.uk)

Title: Jordan's Horizon Supply full set of Foil Prints

Description:
I recently visited Meryl and her team at the Newbury Soup Kitchen, she told me her story, and I spoke to some other people there and was amazed how easily things can change which have catastrophic effects on your home life and well-being and which can ultimately end up with you living on the streets.

I was looking for a worthwhile charity since starting the business and I cannot think of a more worthy cause than to help these people that are so desperately in need. 

On 5th September 2021, I will be taking part in the Newbury Triathlon to help raise money and shine a light on this brilliant non-profit organization. If you can spare a little something I, Meryl, and all the team at Newbury Soup will be incredibly grateful.

Newbury Soup Kitchen strives to help people by providing a broad spectrum of food and outreach to care for the whole person, physically, emotionally, and socially. Spending time with people who need support, encouragement, and empathy to encourage and help them to reach their full potential in every aspect of their lives.

Working to give vulnerable people in our society a voice. This will help them grow in confidence and enable them to make better life decisions to improve their situation and future.

With this donation, we will be able to carry on providing Food Provision, Outreach, and Support to anyone who needs that extra helping hand. 

It is very important to us that everyone is treated with respect, kindness and treated as equals in society, often not experienced by some previously.

We love our work and are committed to strive forward to eventually open a permanent Community Support Centre in the centre of Newbury‚Äô.

Title: Neil's Newbury Triathlon 2021 page

Description:
I am studying Art and Design at College and I have chosen to focus on Urban Environment for my Final Major Project, specifically Homelessness in Peterborough. This is just a small part of my project and I'm partially hoping that it will work as a form of non-traditional public art. Whilst brainstorming ideas for this project, I focused on Peterborough because I have lived here most of my life meaning I have a personal attachment to this specific Urban Environment. A big issue in most urban environments is homelessness because of the overpopulation of the area, meaning it is difficult to earn money and afford a roof over your head, let alone food to eat. This is a huge problem in Peterborough so I'm using this project to start a campaign and raise awareness.

I have started this fundraising page mainly to raise awareness about Peterborough Soup Kitchen. Upon researching them recently, I have found out that they provide food and drinks for 35 - 76 people A DAY. The charity deserves the donations and if you live in or have visited Peterborough, you will know just how many unfortunate, homeless people there are on the streets. I am only asking for small donations as I can sympathise about not having a lot of spare money.

Title: Janis Hewitt's Birthday

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

An estimated 320,000 people are homeless in the UK, according to the latest research by Shelter. This equates to one in every 201 Brits and was an increase of four per cent on the previous year‚Äôs number.

Rough sleepers are just the visible tip of the iceberg when it comes to registering and understanding the homelessness crisis. The widening net of poverty and the breakdown of mental health provision means numbers are growing. Between 4,000 and 5,000 people bed down on the streets on any given night, a figure that has almost doubled since 2010.

Southport Soup Kitchen‚Äôs primary goal is simple:  to provide hot, nourishing food and beverages free of charge to the homeless and disadvantaged of Southport and the immediate locality.

Description: Jan 2017 Meryl set up Newbury Soup Kitchen. It is a voluntary organisation providing help and support to the local homeless, rough sleeper community and those less fortunate. During the Covid-19 crisis, they provide about 300 meals a week. This is done by way of delivery. The food is cooked, bagged up in individual ‚Äògrab bags‚Äô which have a hot vegetarian meal, fruit, snack, drink and homemade cake or biscuit. Newbury Soup Kitchen works solely on food supermarket/public donations, public monetary donations and grants. They cannot do what we do without this. Alexandra and Gabriella feel strongly that they want to help the homeless and those struggling for food at this time.
Title: Anna's Alexandra and Gabriella sleep on the floor

Description:
2020 has been a difficult and different year for everyone. Christmas is fast approaching, but even the festive season has a different feel this year. There are a lot of people who have had a troublesome situation made even worse by the economic effects of COVID, and those who have been newly plunged into hardship. 

As we are unable to run an in-person food bank collection, this year, we are going to be collecting donations via Just Giving, which will be donated to Peterborough Soup Kitchen, to help those in need. It‚Äôd be great if you could consider helping to spread a little additional Christmas cheer by donating. Any donation is a generous one and all funds raised will go towards helping those in need this Christmas.

Title: Ruby Skyes fundraiser for homeless

Description:
Hey Guys! 

So you know this ongoing crisis of homeless starving people and people living below the poverty line, it really brings me down seeing how the numbers have risen, especially here in Peterborough. 

After thinking about the silly ways I spend money, like buying ¬£16 boxes of teabags and how crazy that seems when so many people would rely on that to feed themselves,

I thought I'd actually do something about it and I shall be living on ¬£1 a day for two weeks and all the donations will be going to our local soup kitchen here in Peterborough. 

So tonight when you're eating dinner, or opening some wine or just reaching for a quick snack thinks about hose who can't.

Title: The PTA Big Kitchen Disco!

Description:
Hi Guys,



SHOC are having to move from their home of 20 years as Slough Council have requested their building back. They have found a new place to call home but it has inadequate facilities to feed 50+ people a day and has no showers so people can wash themselves - something I certainly take for granted.

I will be attempting to do everything I can to fit a new kitchen, 2 showers, 2 toilets and as much other work as humanly possible to aid people who desperately need it. Luckily a few companies have offered help so far also, but we still need more:

BenchMarx, High Wycombe will be giving the kitchen for free (benchmarxkitchens.co.uk)

Grant and Stone will provide all building, plumbing and bathroom materials at cost (grantandstone.co.uk)

Jack of Glass, High Wycombe have offered cost price items - windows and splashbacks (jackofglass.co.uk)

My company Howard Smith Premium Builders will be providing all electrical work free as well as a portion of the building (howardsmithbuilders.co.uk)

We urgently need donations (or skilled labour) to assist us and give SHOC the ability to carry on helping people who's lives do depend on it, especially come winter...

Kind regards

Howard Smith

Title: Margaret's Maggies donation instead of xmas cards sent

Description:
Together We Can

The Coronavirus pandemic is an unprecedented time for all of us but vulnerable people in particular are facing more uncertainty than ever. Rough sleepers need additional support to self-isolate and protect themselves from Covid-19. Providing someone with a place to stay, a meal to eat and someone to talk to, are invaluable in supporting struggling individuals find their feet again during times of a global pandemic or otherwise.


Christmas time can be the most difficult for homeless people, both
because of the cold weather that makes sleeping rough even more
dangerous and because of being without family at Christmas. Unfortunately Covid-19 pandemic has only increased this. There are
many factors that can lead to homelessness and it is often the most
vulnerable people in our community that are affected.

To watch the video click the link Together We Can

According to Catching Lives, a homelessness charity aimed at supporting rough sleepers, homeless and vulnerably housed in Canterbury and East Kent, there is even less support available than previous years due to funding cuts by the government. Homelessness rose by a record 22% last year, with 726 deaths in 2018 and expected increase this winter.  For the people that Catching Lives supports, it can be a long journey to getting back on their feet and recovering from the trauma of rough sleeping. Providing someone with a place to stay, a meal to eat and people to talk to, simple things that most of us take for granted, are invaluable first steps to getting the support they need.

At Herringbone Kitchens we know how fortunate we all are to have warm homes. As a company we have supported Catching Lives, for the past 7 years through donations and by giving our time cooking meals for the homeless. A service particuarly close to our hearts is the Catching Lives Night Shelter, which provides 2400 bed spaces over December through to March for people in need. The charity also offers basic meals, showers, laundry and storage facilities.

This year we want to help Catching Lives show the real face of homelessness and to help raise money for the Winter Night Shelter. To encourage businesses and people about the small things we can all do to make a difference, we worked together with Catching Lives to produce a Christmas tale - ‚ÄúTogether We Can‚Äù. This video is a spin on the popular Christmas Ad‚Äôs often ran by large department stores this time of year and has set a goal to help raise ¬£15k to keep the Winter Shelter open.

There were no actors used in the video, the family in the film are Lydia and Rob Merry, clients of Herringbone Kitchens and the homeless man is James Duff, who was previously homeless and now is a Trustee of Catching Lives. Red Cape Productions made and produced the film and Maxine Scott produced and recorded the single ‚ÄòTogether We Can.‚Äô The filming was shot across Canterbury and at the Winter Night Shelter at Catching Lives.

Together there are easy ways to help support the homeless, through giving time or money. Help us help this wonderful charity continue their work keeping people in need safe this winter period - donate here.

Some of the feedback from people who accessed the winter shelter last year ‚Äì

"I have not had to suffer the severe weather conditions. I have also not had to cope with passers-by at night which could be quite frightening when sleeping flat on the ground. It was a relief and very welcome to be offered the opportunity to have a space in the night shelter."

‚ÄúThank you to the churches. Thank you for the peace where we can sleep. Thank you for the tea, coffee and all the food."

Please help this wonderful charity to continue their life saving work keeping homeless people safe this winter.

Title: Tahdiglover Live Kitchen Charity

Description:
Hello and thanks for taking the time to read about my very personal, somewhat mad challenge.


I turn 50 at the beginning of Feb (I mean....how did that happen?) and was determined not to let this be "The Big One" the Covid Grinch stole.  So, I decided to remember this milestone instead as the time I did something really worthwhile by raising money for dementia research.  Why?  Because this is a dreadful disease which steals those we love and we all deserve to grow old with dignity.  I'm an NHS doctor....please believe me.


I love a kitchen disco.  I always have.  One of my earliest memories is waltzing around the kitchen perched on my godfather's feet while mum tried to cook the Sunday roast around us.  That set the pattern for midnight boogieing in Uni digs (oh, INXS), Christmas tree decorating parties for two (Black Eyed Peas will always mean baubles to me!) and grand displays of Riverdance post dinner like any self respecting Irish girl.  Welllll, I had fun even if I wasn't going to score very highly from the Strictly judges.


So, I thought what better way to mark my birthday than in this tried and tested fashion.  From the morning of Saturday Jan 30th I'll be taking to the dance floor for 24 hours, with only a 5 minute break every hour to run to the loo/ change my socks/ sob a little.  Thanks to Covid it's a disco for one, though my amazing partner will be on hand with snacks and encouragement.  (He might even have a wee shimmy!)  Some of my friends have offered to remotely DJ for a couple of hours but, otherwise, it'll be a mix of playlists from my 5 decades interspersed with my trusted Radio 2.


It'll be a long night.  I've worked hard to get fitter and have discovered that I do have a core!  But I'll not lie, it's quite an undertaking and I am nervous.  


I need your help.  Please, please consider sponsoring my effort- not for me but for this important research.  Even if you can't pledge any money, do please send some encouragement to get me through.  Oh and any suggestions for tunes to save me from The Nolans and Kids From Fame on a loop!  You can follow me on twitter on @AreeSinead.  And- thank you!

Oh T and Cs from Just Giving-

Description:
Hello,



Thank you for visiting our fundraising page. The Luton Curry Kitchen is a pioneering partnership project between Community Interest Luton (CIL), and Discover Islam Information Centre to support the needy and vulnerable in Luton.



The food is prepared by Venue Central and distributed by volunteers from the Discover Islam Centre, every Friday. As well as having people visiting the Centre for food, we visit shelters around the town to deliver hot meals to those in temporary shelter.



We encourage locals to get involved with this great cause by donating towards the cause. The Curry Kitchen costs ¬£150 per week to fund and serves more than 100 people each week.



For more information, please email contact@discover-islam.co.uk
Title: Luton Curry Kitchen supporting the needy and homeless of Luton

Description:
Newmarket chef Jamie Mountford appeared on the high profile cooking competition at the end of last year. Although he enjoyed the experience, it was tinged with regret that his late father, who died in February of the same year, did not live to see his television appearance.

Jamie, who works as a chef at the Bedford Lodge Hotel and Spa, was very close to his father, Eric, who suffered a brain injury, as the result of a stroke. Eric Mountford received help from his local Headway and now Jamie wants to raise money for the brain injury charity in recognition of the support his father & family received.

Jamie has organised a pop up restaurant at The Swan in Stow-cum-Quy on the evening of 29th April to raise money for Headway Cambridgeshire. The event, which will consist of a five-course optional meal which will consist of fishcake brioche burger with smoked haddock foam & BBQ'd leek soup. A sauce made from pork pies & pig skin quaver. The event is sold out. Such has been the response that Jamie may need a cancellation list and is looking at the possibility of arranging another similar event, at a later date.


Headway Cambridgeshire provides specialist services and support to people with an acquired brain injury and other neurological conditions and their families across the county.Brain injury can affect anyone, at any time and Headway Cambridgeshire an autonomous charity, supports individuals and their families through these life-changing events, treating clients as individuals and building a bespoke service to meet their needs and aspirations.Our support covers Cambridgeshire or Peterborough, at one of our hubs, in the community or at home.

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I am opening a global Kitchen Cafe which can be found in everyone's kitchen! 

Here I ask you to make your favourite drink and maybe even have cake or a sandwich. In fact, have anything that you might find in your favourite cafe.

Instead of paying the bill, please donate to our incredible NHS.

In this time of lockdown, none of us can visit our local cafe or restaurant, but this way, we can enjoy a cuppa and a cake and give much needed support to the people on the frontline who are saving lives.

And remember.....

Love is something if you give it away,
Give it away, give it away.
Love is something if you give it away,
You end up having more.
It's just like a magic penny,
Hold it tight and you won't have any.
Lend it, spend it, and you'll have so many
They'll roll all over the floor.
For love is something if you give it away,
Give it away, give it away.
Love is something if you give it away,
You end up having more.

words and music by Malvina Reynolds; copyright 1955 and 1958 Northern Music Corporation, renewed 1986. a.k.a. "Love Is Something."

Title: Turing Maggie's Kitchen Table Day

Description:
Hi All,

My brother and I (Patrick and Phoebe Mayhew) were planning on staying in Calais between the 8th and 15th of September and volunteering in The Refugee Community Kitchen for 6 days. However, we both ended up going separately as Patrick had to delay his trip and isolate after testing positive for Covid, instead he left for Calais on the 19th September and is staying there for a week. The refugee kitchen need essential donations, as well as volunteers, in order to keep them running. We are trying to raise some money from friends and family to support their amazing work feeding the refugee camps in Calais - see below for more information from the charity.

'After maintaining a number of their UK Outreach services throughout the pandemic, they are ready to rebuild in Northern France and to resume full service throughout the UK. A small COVID-19 response team, including the co-founders, are re-opening the kitchen, assessing the need in the region and slowly, safely and ethically rebuilding our operations accordingly. They we need your support as we rebuild!Please donate and share, so that they can rebuild our stores of essentials such as rice, spices, gloves, Vegware, beans, oil, fresh veg, fuel and much more!¬£10 = 12 litres of cooking oil¬£20 = 75 tins of tomatoes¬£50 = 55kg Basmati rice¬£100 = 85kg dried beansRCK is 100% dependent on donations, they really need your support in this crucial time. Please help us get back on their feet so that we can continue our mission of serving nutritious food without judgement.'

Thank you so much all - send us both a message if you want to chat to us to find out more.

All the best,

Phoebe and Patrick
Title: Help Refugee Community Kitchen rebuild after COVID-19!

Description:
Salam, pray this message reaches you all in good health. 

We are now raising funds to build a new kitchen for a childrens school in Gambia. 

This school was established in 2009 and has 184 students, that it serves with a quality education, it is an islamic school but also teach subjects such as Maths, Science, English and and Social studies. Through government funding they are able to provide daily nutritious meals to these students. However the facilities in this "kitchen" are not great, currently meals are cooked in a metal shack and is far from a desirable state to cook healthy and nutritous meals. 

Alhumdullilah thanks to a borehole that was recently installed, the children have access to clean water and its time now to go further. With your support, we aim to build a new kitchen where the faciliies are cleaner and in a much better condition to serve these children with daily nutritous meals. 

Any amount you can donate, is truely appreciated by the children of Gambia. 

Jazak'Allah Khair
Title: Build a Kitchen for a Childrens School

Title: Therese's Maggies Kitchen Table Day

Description:
Hi everyone! 

Just a little page I‚Äôve set up here as I know, like many people, I‚Äôve felt a little bit helpless and wanting to support more during this strange time we're all living in. There‚Äôs not one of us who won‚Äôt be effected in some way by what‚Äôs going on and I know we are hearing a lot about the devastation, but there are many positives popping up too with people coming together (virtually), raising money, and the general recognition for the incredible key workers and those on the frontline (NHS, Armed Forces, Carers, Food suppliers and Supermarket workers, Hospital cleaners, Police, Teachers, etc). 


The brilliant 5k challenge got me wondering if there‚Äôs something similar but from home, especially for anyone unable to run or get outside right now. I so far haven‚Äôt found a page where you cook/bake, post, nominate, and DONATE some money for EACH INGREDIENT used in your masterpiece‚Ä¶so this is what I‚Äôm starting here! I‚Äôve seen so many fab chefs and bakers come out of the woodworks during this period - so why not help and donate a little something whilst you‚Äôre at it (it may be something you're making for yourself or others, and can also be a therapeutic way to manage any anxieties this may all be bringing).

 

I‚Äôve baked/made a load of things mainly with ingredients we already had since the lockdown began and have now donated ¬£1 for every ingredient used. Just ONE bake or dish (it doesn‚Äôt have to be cake or anything overly fancy - unless you want it to be! Anything sweet or savoury, baked or cooked) could make a difference (even those ‚Äò3 ingredient recipes‚Äô will still be something) and they can be healthy too (although this isn‚Äôt a requirement...üòâ). We all know some essentials are a little scarce right now so consider it a challenge to get creative too! 


This can include something you‚Äôve made during this period already, just:

- Share a picture of it on your Instagram or Facebook (if you don‚Äôt have access to these, send to someone who can share it for you)

- Add #pitchinfromthekitchen 

- Nominate however many people you‚Äôd like for them to give it a go too (although you DON‚ÄôT need to wait to be nominated as you can start your own chain!)

- And DONATE ¬£1 for EACH ingredient used in that recipe. 

There are tonnes of completely worthy charities this could go to. A key one is of course ‚ÄòNHS Charities Together‚Äô who I donated half to; the other half I donated to Trussell Trust (supporting food banks). As you can only select one charity through Just Giving, ALL donations through this page‚Äôs link will go directly to ‚ÄòNHS Charities Together.‚Äô In addition to the sheer importance of the NHS to me (and all of us), I‚Äôve chosen this one having read about the invaluable support these funds could offer to the incredible NHS volunteers, frontline staff, isolated patients and their families right now, which I‚Äôm hoping will last a long time even after this has passed. I've also heard first hand accounts from those I know who are working at all costs on the frontline; so this is my very small way of saying a very big thank you. 


Here‚Äôs to a target of ¬£200 to start with and kicking it off by nominating people who I know love to bake or cook! Enjoy, and stay safe! x 


NB: Any donations have been processed once you receive the ‚Äòdonation complete or thank you ‚úÖ‚Äô message, but this can take a few hours to show up on the fundraising page.

Instagram: pitch_in_from_the_kitchen 

Facebook: Pitch in from the kitchen 


- - - - - -

Title: David's I am taking up the 20/20 Challenge

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I've been dj-ing for 20 years, I've done the bars, clubs and festivals and nowadays do private events, corporate and weddings and since the lockdown began I've been doing FB LIVE streaming DJ sets from my kitchen, which have quickly turned into a weekly show dubbed the Saturday 'Kitchen Rave'.

Following overwhelming support from thousands of listeners around the globe, I've decided to challenge myself and put my energy and love for music into a mammoth 24hr DJ set to raise as much money as possible for our beloved NHS!!

I've always said I would do this one day... the time has come!

PLEASE JOIN ME ON THIS EPIC JOURNEY!

Starting at 6pm on Friday 8th May, I will DJ my way through 16 different genres of music over a 24hr period finishing with my personal favourite - the Saturday Kitchen Rave Trance Anthems show on Saturday 9th May 4-6pm!

There are NHS and frontline workers doing much more challenging 24hr shifts so the very least I can do is play a whole heap of music in their honour, but I need your help!

Please check out the music schedule here and on my Facebook page (search - Dj Graham Meeres) and join me for whatever music you love to listen to. 

Most importantly - this is a one time event and I want to make the biggest impact possible so please dig deep and give as generously as you can! 

Thanks for all your support so far. Please get involved, share and tag away as many people as you can and if you know anyone in the MEDIA/TV/NEWS business please give them a nudge and let's make this event go national!

ENJOY!

Me and Georgia are aiming to do a skydive on the 25th June. My charity I‚Äôve chosen is for ‚ÄòClinks care farm‚Äô and this is something close to my heart. As many know my autistic brother who is also mute attends here, makes friends and they do everything in their power to provide support in all aspects. They‚Äôve been part of my life for a while and never seen a fault. So as a little charity I thought I would do this skydive to help support the amazing work they already do. If you can‚Äôt donate just a share of this would be appreciated. If you can donate you can do it through this page or to me directly if easier. Thank you so much. üòäüí™


The next big expense for Clinks Care Farm is the expansion and enlargement of the Log Cabin kitchen area. This was needed even before Coronavirus because more Farm Helpers and Volunteers have been coming to the Farm. Now, with the new arrangements having to be put in place because of the virus, the enlarged area is vital before the autumn and winter months so we can safely meet up, have lunch and socialise - which is an important part of being on the Farm. The charity has already raised some funds, but our fundraising events for this year are cancelled so we are running out of time to get the works completed. Please help us out to ensure this vital piece of work can be finished as soon as possible. Thank you!

Description:
Thank you for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

The Kitchen Croxley is so proud to partner with Peace Hospice Care. We were excited and looking forward to their Fundraising Dinner this week, for which we had baked 150 cupcakes.

Sadly today they made this announcement which we agree with totally.  "We are very sad to announce that we have taken the difficult decision to postpone our major fundraising events for the next 3 months ‚Äì including our Charity Dinner and London Bridges Walk.  This is due to concerns about the Coronavirus (COVID-19)."

Rather than waste the cupcakes we had baked we offered them to our Facebook followers in return for a donation. The response has totally overwhelmed us. Over sixty people have shared our page, including the legendary footballer Luther Blissett. We have had donations from overseas and now a request to set up this page.

The cupcakes have all gone but we are baking more. We are also asking/inviting others to make donations simply because the Fundraising Dinner is so vital to the income of the Peace Hospice.

So here is the thing. Please donate the cost of a cup of coffee. Or a glass of wine, pint of beer or cocktail. Afternoon Tea if you feel able, or simply a cupcake. Pop in and pick one up if you are local.

Our original target was ¬£100 but let's make that ¬£1000. The work these people do is just so wonderful and the effort they put into this event just awesome. Please bring a smile to their faces and to those of their patients too. Thank you!

Mrs Kitchen x

Description: Update on my challenge! I have now potted up over 80 tree seedlings that have been popping up in my garden and would otherwise have been thrown away.  Can you sponsor me to finish this task ??  They seem to be growing pretty well - though a squirrel did dig into the pots where the horse chestnuts were growing to get at the conkers !  I have already found homes for 15 trees - thank you everyone.
Title: Log Cabin and Kitchen Extension

Description: After 40 successful years providing first class customer service Avanti are looking to give a little bit back to the communities who have supported us for so long. To celebrate our 40th anniversary we are aiming to raise ¬£40,000 for charities that our very much close to all of our hearts. Please keep an eye on our website for a list and updates of the activities we have planned throughout the year.
Title: Avanti Kitchens - Beacon Centre

Description: The next big expense for Clinks Care Farm is the expansion and enlargement of the Log Cabin kitchen area. This was needed even before Coronavirus because more Farm Helpers and Volunteers have been coming to the Farm. Now, with the new arrangements having to be put in place because of the virus, the enlarged area is vital before the autumn and winter months so we can safely meet up, have lunch and socialise - which is an important part of being on the Farm. In order to achieve this we need to raise ¬£10,000. The charity has already raised some funds, but our fundraising events for this year are cancelled so we are running out of time to get the works completed. Please help us out to ensure this vital piece of work can be finished as soon as possible. Thank you!
Title: Log Cabin and Kitchen Extension

Description: The Universal Church of the Kingdom of God (UCKG) is a Christian Ministry and registered charity (1043985) dedicated to helping people live life to the fullest ‚Äî physically, emotionally and spiritually.Over the years, we have reached such a diverse group of people that our work has touched millions across over 170 countries. Their unique stories remind us that with the right kind of help and support, the most heartbreaking stories can become tomorrow‚Äôs inspirational ones. Title: Veneice's fundraiser

Description:
I will be running the Great South Run on Sunday 17th October 2021, in aid of the LIFEHOUSE food and Soup Kitchen based in Southsea, Portsmouth.

This is a cause very close to my heart.

Not everyone we see homeless is a hopeless case, or that being homeless is deserved. People go through difficult times and, without intention, may find themselves homeless. We should try and help these individuals extract themselves from these challenging times.

The help that the LIFEHOUSE gives to the homeless and people in difficult situations, be it food, clothing, or just somewhere warm for a couple of hours, is immeasurable to those who do not have a loving family, a home or a safe place.

Please give what you can' even the smallest donations make a difference. Make someone happy this festive period.

All the best.

Jason

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Those of you who know me know I love a Gin or a cheeky vino but to help do something positive during our country's 2.0 lockdown I am going to stop the drink and go sober and try and raise money for The Lifehouse.

The LifeHouse is a kitchen, resource and support centre that serves hot food in Albert Road, Southsea. The centre opens every week for Hot Breakfast / Brunch on Wednesdays from 9am and a nutritious Hot Dinner on Thursdays from 6pm to all those who need it.  

I have always struggled to see homeless and hear of people hungry and not be able to do much about it so thought this might be a great way to raise funds for the centre.  If you can spare a few quid, it would be fantastic especially during these challenging and difficult times.

Title: Jason's page

Description:
We will be able soon, with your generous support, to seat and feed double the number of homeless, underhoused and rehabilitating guests 2-3 times a week in this new, large, comfortable space. For the first time they will all be able to choose where they sit and for how long (especially vital in cold and wet weather when rough sleepers need to take time to ‚Äúwarm-up‚Äù and dry out). The newly enlarged LifeHouse will seat 50-55 diners, not the 28 we squeeze in now!

Our guests will not be hurried along to make way for the next person. Sadly queueing outside in all weathers had been a regular feature of the LifeHouse up to now.  On a Thursday evening diners can enjoy some live music from all sorts of local artists free of charge. So this can become an unhurried, dignified and sociable meal out for our guests rather than a short, scrambled meal limited by time and have coffee after in the sofa area.

The major design, surveying, permissions and building work, is being done and very generously paid for by PMC Construction: www.pmcconstruction.co.uk.  Since 1982, PMC Construction has developed housing and commercial schemes that are built to last.

The front of the building seen here will be the new, main dining room and we hope that you might decide to help us refurbish and equip it! The lighting is very outdated and needs replacing. We will need a range of trolleys and serving equipment. The old diner area will be kept to provide a space where people can get support can sit, have coffee, play table football or table-tennis or just chill out and socialise - something they don‚Äôt get to do before. 

In this season ahead we need to fund decoration, folding tables,
lighting, heated food trays, trolleys, extra fridge and floor coverings.
Title: RAISING FUNDS FOR DINING HALL REFURBISHMENT & EQUIPMENT

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Planning lessons and marking are no longer on my to do list in the evenings, so I have been able to help a local hub to sew scrubs and have recently started making a few face masks during my spare time. I thought this is a great opportunity to raise money for a charity that runs by the people who are very close to my heart. The LifeHouse is a resource, support centre and kitchen that serves hot food in Albert Road, Southsea. They aim to target immediate needs and issues surrounding homelessness and addiction for those in need in Southsea. This place relies heavily on a team of dedicated volunteers (who are amazing!!) and local donations with food, clothing etc. Since their recent site expansion and refurbishment, they are hoping to be able to upgrade their kitchen equipment, furniture, and more importantly to be able to accommodate more people who are in needs. 

There is no set price of each face mask, but we ask for minimum donation of ¬£7 for each which include postage. Each mask contains a small strip of wire so it can sit nicely on your nose. With a pocket on the reverse side where you can insert additional materials. Pattern choices are limited so message me for stock availability. Once you have made your donation, message me with your pattern choice and address and I aim to dispatch within 5 working days (I can only make these in the evenings!)
Title: Vivys homemade face masks

Description:
Three members of our Canteen team are braving an abseil down The Spinnaker Tower this June!

Emma, Lacey and Beth will face their fears by abseiling 100m down the side of the city's iconic landmark all in aid of charity.

Our chosen charity for the year is The LifeHouse Southsea. Based in the heart of Southsea, The LifeHouse is a support centre and kitchen that targets the immediate needs and issues surrounding homelessness and addiction in Portsmouth.

All support will be greatly appreciated, whether it's a donation or simply going down to cheer them on! We wish them all the best of luck! Go on girls!

Team Canteen X
Title: The Canteen's Spinnaker Tower Abseil

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Written on 29.01.2020

In April 2020, it will be two years since I started my running journey with a Couch to 5K course.  So what better way to mark that anniversary than with a full marathon in Brighton.  The whole 26.2 miles.  Eeek!

Outdoor running wasn't something that I thought I would enjoy or be any good at...(I really didn't like cross country at school!)...but I soon found a huge passion for it, that I never knew I had.  Especially trail running or road running with great views.  I'm very lucky that I live next to the sea and nearby forests to explore.  The support of a great running club has made a massive difference.  Social running is never dull.

I normally  do races just for fun...but running my first marathon provides the perfect opportunity to help a worth while local cause.  

I first heard about the Lifehouse charity when I took part in the Great South running weekend with colleagues back in October 2018.  We jointly raised funds and I knew it was a charity I would like to support again.  They do a fantastic job supporting the homeless and those with addictions in Southsea.  If you can help at all please, that would be marvellous! 

11-09-20 UPDATE

We all know Covid-19 tried to get in the way of us having fun. The Brighton marathon was of course cancelled.   I was gutted.  I am still determined to run a marathon though, as soon as I can!

The plan is to run the Portsmouth Coastal Marathon on 20th December.  I'm about to properly restart my long distance training.  I haven't let my fitness slip at all during lockdown ...so feeling ready to do this.

06-11-20 UPDATE

The Portsmouth Coastal marathon was cancelled in October, so a new plan was quickly hatched.  My husband and I signed up to the God of Thunder II race at Denbies wine estates in Dorking.  This was a 5K lapped event that took place on 1st November.  We managed 8 laps for the full marathon distance!  This wasn't a flat marathon.  There was 2,600 feet of elevation thrown in for fun!

The medal was rather epic.  See photo above.

I am so pleased we both managed to run our first marathons in 2020 after all!

Thank you for reading
Title: Alex is doing a marathon

Description:
In 2018 and 2019, I joined thousands of other volunteers at Crisis at Christmas as a catering volunteer at one of their London day centres. The afternoon shift cooked up hundreds of portions of hot mains and puddings every evening and I peeled more potatoes than I ever thought I could.

In 2020, Crisis at Christmas was much different. For safety reasons, there were no day centres and only a minimal number of experienced volunteers. Guests needing shelter were hosted in hotels with external catering provided. 

2021 marks the 50th Crisis at Christmas and this year there will be some day centres running, with hotel accommodation for those in need of shelter. It still wont be the same scale of operation we saw back in 2019, but it's a step forward in being able to support more guests again.

So on 27th, 28th and 29th December, me and my trusty potato peeler will be back, cooking up breakfasts and a hot lunch.This year a place at Crisis at Christmas costs ¬£29.06 and with your help I'd love to raise enough funds for ten spaces. Your donation will help provide:

~ Accommodation
~ Hot meals, including a Christmas dinner
~ Befriending scheme
~ Year-round access to training and education services
Title: Crisis at Christmas Catering Volunteer 2021

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

We recently attended and Anti Poverty evening in Kirkcaldy and I was shocked to find out that Kirkcaldy foodbank alone spend ¬£8000 per month on food! Run by 100 volunteers. More than one third of those who receive support from Kirkcaldy foodbank are children. 8650 food parcels per month are given out from Kirkcaldy foodbank. These figures left me feeling very sad and that I wanted to do something to help.

I know many of us have our kitchen cupboards packed so full that if we simply cleared away the tins of soup we aren't going to use, the pasta packets that we have 4 of along with the excess boxes of cereal we have never looked at. That we together could help these people and help Kirkcaldy foodbank, even if its a drop in the ocean for them.

That is why I am asking you all to please donate ¬£5 worth of food from your cupboards, or ¬£5 from your purse/ wallet.

In return, your name will be entered into our draw to win a kitchen deep clean inc oven clean to the value of ¬£80. Once the draw ends I will pull one name from a hat and that lucky winner will receive this offer. You can enter as many times as you like. So go on, have that kitchen clear out and see just how much you have that can be donated, I bet its a lot more than you think!!!

Thank you in advance,

Cara and all the team at Domestic Matters x

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

The Kitchen and Management teams at Beefeater Marsh Mills are joining in the 2.6 charity challenge. We always try to do what we can to help those who need the help the most. We have done it successfully in the past so we would like to set another challenge.

We are going to ride, walk, run, hop and skip the distance from our Restaurant to Great Ormond Street Hospital and back in 10 days. That's a total of 419 miles!  The team will be recording their contributions on Strava. 

As we always say: we are Team Awesome. We are confident that we will smash our challenge and hopefully raise lots of money to to help save children's lives and support their families. 

Every donation makes a huge difference. Especially during these unstable and challenging times for everybody, it is so important to show that together we are stronger!
Title: Marsh Mills Kitchen Team Virtual Long Distance Race

Description:
Emily is a qualified Nordoff Robbins Music Therapist. Like many people over the last year she has had to move most of her work online. Despite the pandemic, Emily has provided remote music therapy sessions, group sensory music sessions and most recently a SNAP online choir. She is also part of the team bringing Radio SNAP to Facebook Live every Friday morning at 9.30am on SNAP's Facebook page (link below). Families have told SNAP that these sessions are often the highlight of their week!

As if all this wasn't enough, exemplary Emily is also supporting SNAP with an incredible 24-hour Disco!

"I have been involved with SNAP charity for nearly 12 years now, and it holds a very special place in my heart. I love our Friday Facebook Live sessions each week and when I accidentally suggested that I should do a 24-hour Kitchen Disco fundraiser, I initially thought - what have I done?!

However, literally seconds after I thought what better way to show my support for all of the fantastic work that SNAP does, than to offer what I love most in the world - music!

Music is such a lifeline for me and for so many people, especially over the lockdowns this past year. Our online sessions have enabled people to come together through their love and enjoyment of music, so why not offer this for 24 hours!!

I will be holding our Kitchen Disco live from The SNAP Centre along with the wonderful Karen and Dale from 9:30am on Friday 5th March, all the way through to 9:30am on Saturday 6th March, singing and playing requests from people who are able to support and join us on the SNAP Facebook page. I will also have some fun musical games, as well as some special friends who will pop by to sing or play us a song to keep us going!

A 24-hour Kitchen Disco is going to be hard, so if you are able to sponsor us in advance or donate on the day we would really appreciate it. Join us on the SNAP Facebook page as well to give us some words of encouragement - we're going to need it!!!"

This really is an incredible challenge and we can not wait to watch it live on SNAP's Facebook page - https://www.facebook.com/SnapCharity 

Every donation is hugely appreciated and will go a long way towards helping SNAP continue to be here for Essex families who have a child or young person with any special need or disability. Thank you for helping make this possible. 

If you'd like to find out more about SNAP (Special Needs And Parents) please do visit:

  • Our Website:  https://www.snapcharity.org/ 
  • Our Impact Page which has a great video:  https://www.snapcharity.org/our-impact/
  • Our Facebook page:  https://www.facebook.com/SnapCharity
  • Or read our latest SNAP Matters Magazine:  https://www.snapcharity.org/about/snap_matters_magazines/
Title: Emily's 24-hour Kitchen Disco at SNAP

The UK government has stated two visitors are allowed in care homes to reunite with loved one which is why I've designed this Sharing is Caring Treats Box, priced at ¬£12.

Description: The Kindness Kitchens have been working from Clarence Rd carpark for several years and were known as the soup kitchens (Homeless Eats, Street Spirit, Mikey's Memory Kitchen and the Homeless Hub). They have been dedicated community groups who are determined to support vulnerable people in our community.  Most nights of the week, they provide hot meals to those in need. These are amazing acts of kindness.  St Vincent's Southend Community Support Hub  have partnered with the Kindness Kitchens who are now united in providing this essential service from a safe and under cover building.  These funds that are being raised will be put towards their operations such as rent, food supplies and other resources needed to support the vulnerable people that they feed.  Please visit our website at www.svpwestcliff.org if you want to join our volunteers in supporting those in need or donate to this fund to support all the great work that the Kindness kitchens do.

Description:
PTSD UK is the only UK charity dedicated to the education about and awareness raising of Post Traumatic Stress Disorder, it's causes, symptoms & the treatments available - no matter the trauma that caused it.

Our mission is to provide support and information for anyone affected by PTSD (and their friends and family). We campaign to improve services, raise awareness and promote understanding of the condition and treatments available.
Title: Jessica's Hart Healing Kitchen charity raffle

Description:
I'm running the London Marathon in October with my sister, 10 years since we last ran for one of our wonderful friends charity Fight For Sight.  Emma set up The Tommy Salisbury Fund in 2005, when her then 5 year old son Tommy was diagnosed with Choroideremia, a rare genetic eye condition.  This would mean that Tommy's sight would start to deteriorate from his late teens until total blindness later in his life.  Rather than taking this news and being beaten by it the family set about raising money to find a treatment and hopefully a cure.  

Emma along with the support of all her friends and family have so far raised over ¬£600,000 and this money has funded a trial which Tommy himself has been lucky enough to have been a patient... one of his eye's has been treated and currently there has been no further deterioration of his sight.

There is still work and research to be done to make this trial available to all Choroideremia suffers.

Please help us raise money to help fund this cutting edge research and treatment... your money can actually help cure this which is just amazing.

Every ¬£5 donation will be a ticket to win one of our beautiful wooden and persex art easels, perfect for children of all ages worth over ¬£350.

The lucky winner can choose the colours and have it personalised, delivery included UK Mainland Only, the winner will be picked at random on Monday 22nd February and announced shortly after.

Multiple tickets can be bought, for example ¬£20 will get you 4 tickets with all money going direct to the charity.

Thank you for your support and good luck xx
Title: Raffle to win a wooden Mud Kitchen Easel

Description:
On 15th Jan 2021 I went to the Dr with a tender side, by 24th Feb 2021 I underwent major surgery for at The Royal Marsden, Chelsea for Ovarian Cancer Stage 3, I am now under going Chemotheraphy at The Royal Marsden, Sutton. I have been extremely lucky with all the care given to me and the resources I have made a great deal of use of are from Macmillan. 

I wanted to do something to raise money for charity and decided that since I wanted to use a Macmillan resource, Recipes for People Affected by Cancer and hold some cook togethers - this would be a good starting point. 

The recipes are simple, healthy and during the sessions I will discuss how they can be adapted. All info will come from the above resource. You don't have to have cancer to join in, all sessions will be a friendly place to be, you don't even need to cook! I have initially set up three sessions but if they are popular, I will carry on - I used to have people to my house to cook but for the time being this will be equally lovely to do.

Any donation would be welcome as a one -off or per session -  or just to donate to an amazing cause and help others - up to you.

If you want to book onto one of the Zoom Cook togethers then here is the link which will give you all the info. If you cant make it live they will be recorded and you will be sent a link.

https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/ruths-little-kitchen-cook-together-tickets-150883439429

So thanks for supporting my fundraising. Below a little more about Macmillan.

At Macmillan, we give people with cancer everything we‚Äôve got. If you‚Äôre diagnosed, your worries are our worries. We‚Äôre doing whatever it takes. But without your help we can‚Äôt support everyone who needs us.

Title: Janet Kitchen & Robert Searles's Wedding

Description:
Hello everyone my name is Darren but to most, I am Ghostie. A couple of months ago I decided to start using my spare time at home to raise funds for Wakefield Street Kitchen through streaming games regularly on Twitch (GhostKiyo).

Here is my chosen charity, Wakefield Street Kitchen and here's what they do:

They go out every Wednesday evening, serving our homeless and less fortunate, providing them with sleeping bags, tents, food, warm drinks, toiletries, outreach packs, clothes and many more essentials.

I created this page to ensure the full amount donated by my viewers goes directly to them.

I'd love for you to share in this cause as we play our part for those in need.

Description:
Hello friends of Derby, 

On 26th January 2017, a day after my 21st birthday, our family has rescued a dog which was abused and abandoned on the streets of South Korea. We've named her "Gaon (Í∞ÄÏò®)", an acronym from the following phrase - "Í∞ÄÎßåÌûà ÏûàÏóàÎäîÎç∞ ÏÑ†Î¨ºÏ≤òÎüº Îã§Í∞ÄÏò® Í∞ïÏïÑÏßÄ" - which means "a dog which has entered into our family's lives like a surprise gift" in Korean. 

She has been a real gift to our family - animal welfare has taken a huge place in our hearts ever since.

About the project:

From now until 25th January 2022, I will start a cook-sale/bake-sale project to help raise funds for the RSPCA, a non-profit organisation dedicated to rescuing animals when they need us most, rehabilitate them wherever possible, provide them with the very best veterinary care, and to find them new homes, either through rehoming or release. 

I'd like to ask for your generous contributions to this charity in exchange for the Korean foods I'll cook and prepare just for you, upon order (details below). I can't believe there is no Korean restaurants in Derby - the rich Korean flavours must be tried!

How ordering works:

  • Please access the following link to my Instagram page  dedicated to this project:
  • Ordering from menu: Using the "Menu" highlight, please see the menus you'll be able to order from. You'll also be able to check the ingredients and ensure they suit your dietary requirements using the "Ingredients" highlight. Once you've chosen your menu, please make an order through the Google form linked in the Instagram profile. 
  • Custom ordering: If there's a specific Korean menu you've always wanted to try but isn't available in the menus, please let me know and I might be able to whip something up! :)
  • You're most welcome to donate any amounts - but this will need to be at least GBP 5 per serving and per dish to cover costs. All collections will be donated to RSPCA via this donation page. 

How delivery works:

  • Please be advised that the foods will be delivered only on weekends. The foods will be prepared at high standards of hygiene and cleanliness on the day of the delivery, for freshness. Food safety is my number one priority!
  • Depending on the delivery location, I may be able to arrange a meet up with you to deliver the foods, or you may need to come pick them up from my place. If required, you'll be sent details of my location.

About RSPCA:

  • RSPCA continue saving animals most in need throughout England and Wales.The RSPCA received over 1 million calls from members of the public in 2018 and rescued over 102,900 animals. If you would like to find out more about the work the RSPCA does please take a look at their website: www.rspca.org.uk/whatwedo

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Background - I've been dj-ing for 20 years, I've done the bars, clubs and festivals and nowadays (aside from my day job) I do private events, corporate and weddings and since the lockdown began I've been doing LIVE streaming DJ sets from my kitchen, which have quickly turned into a weekly show dubbed the Saturday 'Kitchen Rave'.

Last year I set out to achieve a life long DJ ambition of DJ-ing NON STOP for 24hrs and not only did that happen, but I managed to raise nearly ¬£20k (with Gift Aid) for our beloved NHS!

This year I am celebrating 40 yrs of age and for that I've decided to challenge myself even further, set the bar even higher and put my energy and love for music into a ridiculous 40hr DJ set to raise as much money as possible for the incredible charity - MIND!!

PLEASE JOIN ME ON THIS EPIC JOURNEY!

Starting at 8pm Friday 19th March I will DJ my way through 40hrs of music finishing mid-day Sunday the 21st!! The number of genres is too long to list but I will publish these on my Facebook page soon so you can tune in to whatever you like!

Most importantly - this is a one time event and I want to make the biggest impact possible so please dig deep and give as generously as you can! 

Thanks for all your support so far. Please get involved, share and tag away as many people as you can and if you know anyone in the MEDIA/TV/NEWS business please give them a nudge and let's make this event go national!

ENJOY!

Description:
The People's Kitchen try to provide 1 new pair of boxer shorts and 2 pairs of socks to each of our friends on a weekly basis. At the moment, stock of these items is really low and the charity are seeking urgent donations.

Socks are the items that are donated the least, mainly because we all tend to wear these until they have holes and then we throw them away! Friends of the Kitchen are often out on the streets in all weathers and don't have the facility to dry damp footwear which can lead to blisters, sores and infections.

Please donate whatever you can so we can help The People's Kitchen provide new items to those most in need.

Thank you for your support.
Title: The People's Kitchen Socks & Boxers Appeal

Description:

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I am Sara and I‚Äôve been working as a rider at Neil Mulholland Racing for 3 years now and loved every minute. 

I will be riding Soupy Soups in the 1m2f Racing Welfare charity race the 24th of October 2021 at Wincanton Racecourse.


For all of you that know me, it‚Äôs no surprise how thrilled I am for the chance of riding the yard all time favourite horse in a ‚Äúreal race‚Äùand, for once, experience what it feels to be on the saddle on the other side of the white railing. 


For all of you that don‚Äôt know me, this could be a lovely opportunity to see how incredibly loved racehorses are and how hard stable staff works towards their fitness and  overall well being. 

Please join me in this race helping me raising money for the charity that is making this possible!


Follow my journey here or on my Instagram page: _alaskan_sun_



Racing welfare is an amazing charity that provides guidance and support to everyone who works in the racing industry and their families, throughout their career ‚Äì from recruitment to retirement.

I came across Racing Welfare Charity when I joined the National Horseracing College a few years back and the help and support I have received from them it has always been outstanding. I am currently training for my HGV driving license thanks to their grants scheme to help people improve into their career paths and always be grateful for it. 

I also want to thank my trainer Neil Mulholland and horse‚Äôs  owner Equis ex Inceris partners for giving me this chance. 

Thank you so much for your support! 

Sara

His Mummy Nicola created the charity to help others who are facing or already dealing with similar heartbreak, walking side-by-side with families offering emotional and practical support for parents and siblings bereaved of a child and for families of life limited or threatened children who face uncertain futures. Description:
I will be DJing for 24-hours non-stop from 8pm on Friday 5th Feb right through until 8pm on the Saturday evening!

The amazing team at Helping our Homeless Wales need our support - the van which they use to deliver vital food and supplies all across Wales and into Herefordshire is knackered and has to be replaced - I want to help them raise the ¬£3,500 they need.

With lockdown 3.0 in full effect, staying in is back as the new going out, so I‚Äôll be doing my best to put some much-needed sparks on your (indoor, socially distant) sparklers!

I will be streaming live from The Globe in Hay via my Mixcloud page from dusk until dawn and then back to dusk again, with a very special and very, very extended set. As well as the usual dance-floor bangers, disco debauchery and high-energy party house, I will be taking you on a cosmic journey via the best in soul, reggae, D&B, 90‚Äôs trance and even some ‚Äô80‚Äôs re-edits! 

In return please can you donate what you can to the appeal through this page and help us smash the target.

As part of my set from 2pm - 4pm on the Saturday afternoon I will be switching across to host my new radio show on the EXT Radio Mixcloud page for a couple of hours which I‚Äôm super excited about - let‚Äôs hope I‚Äôm still awake!

So dig out your glad rags, dust off your dancing shoes, grab your cocktail shaker, plug in your disco lights, tell your mates and get involved!
Title: 24-Hour Kitchen Disco Live DJ Stream!

Description:
Remember how a couple of years ago I helped raise funds for a township classroom for some of the most poverty stricken children in South Africa? Well I'm visiting Cape Town in April 2019 and I have learned that some children still don't have kitchen where nutritious food can be prepared safely.

I have some amazing friends who have supported me already. Arafat Gatabazi swam with me at the Cape of Good Hope Castle. Sarah Gray held a 'sing for your super' event and lots of you came to the fundraising evening at Longhoughton, Westfield Park

Thanks to your generosity these children now have a classroom 


I would love to be able to contribute to a kitchen facility when I visit in April. I will do something crazy when I'm there to thank you for your donations - climb a mountain in the searing heat or find somewhere unusual to swim (hopefully croc, shark & hippo free). 

I'm travelling to Swedish Lapland this weekend to swim in the coldest river in Sweden. The air will be minus 15'c and the water below zero too (I'm doing this whilst recovering from a chest infection)

Please will you donate? I have 900 friends on facebook. If everyone donates a couple of quid it will go a long way to supporting these beautiful children who deserve the basics

Many many thanks

Description:
The CPA Global One Kitchen Challenge has been one way we've been keeping connected as one global community. Nourishing our well being through food and cooking, at a time when we've been socially isolating and working remotely as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. 

Our people have treated us to delicious recipes, mouth-watering pictures and videos of food they've cooked for themselves and their families, and stories of what cooking means to them. To capture this moment and these recipes, we've created our very own CPA Global One Kitchen Challenge Cookbook, 

To help do our part to raise money for charities working the COVID-19 front line across the world, we're giving away copies of the cookbook in return for a charitable donation. 

To get your personal copy of the cookbook, while also raising money for the Coronavirus Relief Fund, all you need to do is donate here. 

Your donation to the Coronavirus Relief Fund will make an immediate and lasting positive impact during one of the most challenging times we have collectively faced.
Title: CPA Global's One Kitchen Challenge Cookbook

Description:
Hello everybody, my name is Myles. I might only be little but I wanted to do my bit to support a great charity who have helped me and my family a lot. As some of you may know, I was born with a cleft palate and got my new mouth in March of this year. I am really enjoying staying at home with my Mummy and Daddy and have recently taken up walking (with the help of some new wheels). My plan is that each day, I will complete 26 laps of the kitchen island. I will do this for 26 days. I will take requests for songs to do my walking to, and Mummy and Daddy will share some clips of my efforts on here (first one available to view now: Mummy picked the song to get us started. See https://youtu.be/X_LyLxVUdkE).

My Mummy wanted you to know that this fantastic charity are in real danger of collapse due to the pandemic. CLAPA works with our local cleft team to provide feeding equipment, support, as well as being the national voice for the progression of cleft care. And we want to do our bit to help.

Mummy also wanted me to let you know that she is cooking 26 new recipes for me to eat and will share progress for anyone that is interested. She hasn't set a time limit for this as she thinks she's got enough on, what with the lockdown and everything.

We know it's a difficult time, but if you are able to support our event, we would really appreciate it, and know this fantastic charity would too.

With much love,

Myles Arthur Kelly xxxx

(almost nine months)

#twopointsixchallenge #CLAPA #1in700 #Mylesaroundthekitchen

Description:
The CPA Global One Kitchen Challenge has been one way we've been keeping connected as one global community. Nourishing our well being through food and cooking, at a time when we've been socially isolating and working remotely as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. 

Our people have treated us to delicious recipes, mouth-watering pictures and videos of food they've cooked for themselves and their families, and stories of what cooking means to them. To capture this moment and these recipes, we've created our very own CPA Global One Kitchen Challenge Cookbook, 

To help do our part to raise money for charities working the COVID-19 front line across the world, we're giving away copies of the cookbook in return for a charitable donation. 

To get your personal copy of the cookbook, while also raising money for the British Red Cross, all you need to do is donate here. 

 Your donation can change their life.The British Red Cross will use your donation wherever the need is greatest in the UK.
Title: CPA Global's One Kitchen Challenge Cookbook

Description:
This will be the 10th time I run the London Marathon in aid of The National Brain Appeal. This time I'll be joined by my son Jim which will give me an extra push to keep up! We've been doing a fair few training runs during lockdown along with our dog Victor (who's named after Victor Horsley, father of neurosurgery).

The money I raise will go towards the charity's Neurosurgery fund, which is there to provide state-of-the-art equipment, facilities for The National's neurosurgery unit - the largest in the UK. It provides a local, national and international service for specialised neurosurgical problems such as epilepsy, Parkinson's disease, movement disorders and pituitary tumours. The fund also supports much-needed research.

Previous projects as part of the Neurosurgery fund include the building of a new specialist spinal operating theatre, and the recent doubling in size of the Molly Lane Fox ward for patients with brain tumours.

Thank you to everyone who is generously making a donation to support our challenge. The National Brain Appeal really does make a vital difference to the care of our patients, and I'm delighted to do my small part to help improve the outcome for patients affected by neurological conditions.

With best wishes,

Neil, Jim & Victor
Title: Neil & Jim Kitchen run the London Marathon!

Description:
The Passage is a London based charity whose mission is to provide resources which encourage, inspire and challenge homeless people to transform their lives. They help the homeless in a number of ways, through outreach programmes, provision of food and washing facilities, healthcare- with the overall aim to get them back on their feet again and into accommodation. 

As a result of this worthy cause, the WP Team are volunteering to help out The Passage Resource Centre in October. We are completing a kitchen takeover, so we will be helping out preparing food, serving the customers, talking with them and hopefully making their day a little brighter. 

However the help that we will provide/hinder (!) will not be enough to keep this fantastic charity going! The WP team would therefore be hugely grateful if you could possibly support us with fundraising for The Passage.

Description:
The Curry Kitchen
The Curry Kitchen is a pioneering partnership project with Community Interest Luton, Venue Central, Discover Islam Information Centre and local businesses. Our aim is to provide hot meals to the most needy in Luton once a week.


We run a weekly Curry Kitchen service as well as delivering food prepared to homeless shelters in the locality. The project is sponsored by the local business community.

Description:
The Curry Kitchen is a pioneering partnership project between Community Interest Luton and Discover Islam Information Centre and local businesses.

Each hot and nutritious meal costs just ¬£1.80 per person and every penny of your donation goes towards providing the meal. So you know that everything you give will help feed someone in need.

We have provided over 26,000 hot meals since we started, which is truly amazing! But we need to make sure we can keep feeding those people most in need each week and have to raise around ¬£9,360 to provide enough meals for one year.

COVID has had a huge impact on this project. Firstly, the need and demand for hot food has gone up significantly and this will only get worse as the nights get longer, it gets colder and the weather gets worse.

A donation of ¬£18 will help feed ten people and provide them with a safe and warm space to eat, talk to others and access the additional support they need. Anything you can donate to help the homeless and vulnerable people from across the town, would be directly helping to relieve hunger and loneliness in Luton.

CharityId: England and Wales (802047) and in Scotland (SC0407
Description:
Having a child in hospital is a frightening time for families, more so amongst a global pandemic. Three Cranswick sites (Gourmet Kitchen, Gourmet Sausage and Convenience) are teaming up with the aim of raising money for Ronald McDonald House Charity to support the families who have children in hospital. Starting from Wednesday 17th for 72hours, Cranswick Gourmet Sausage and Cranswick Convenience Foods are going head to head in a cycling Peloton Challenge to see how many miles they do between them, whilst also deciding which site will go champion. 

Ronald McDonald House Charities UK provides free ‚Äòhome away from home‚Äô accommodation to families with children having treatment in hospital. Our Houses offer much more than just a place to stay; they provide family activities, peer support, respite, and many other services. This means that families can be by their child‚Äôs bedside in a matter of moments, whilst maintaining a degree of normal life with reduced emotional and financial strain.We help over 6,000 families each year and now, more than ever, we need your support. Thank you.
Title: Cranswick Gourmet Kitchen Head to Head Peloton Challenge

Description:
Since my cancer operation last year I have visited the Maggie's Centre in Newcastle many times.  I consider that it has played a big part in my recovery. 

It is great to go there at any time, have a cuppa and a chat - and usually lots of cake etc!  The volunteers and cancer support nurses are fabulous and there is a positive and welcoming atmosphere.  In addition you can chat to other people who are going through the same thing as you.

I have also attended courses there, eg mindfulness.  The workshops I have done included 'Look Good Feel Better' which was great!

I would like to raise money for Maggie's so that other people can enjoy all these activities too!
Title: Kitchen Table Day for Maggie's Cancer Centre  4 May 12.30 to 2.30 pm
